title: Which career is right for me if I am interested in math, chemistry and bio? - Quora

response.answer_text: We can’t say. If for instance someone suggests “medicine,” but you’re afraid of dealing with sick people and faint at the sight of blood, that would be a bad choice. But give some thought to the quality of life and salary you hope to achieve since these will be mostly determined by your career choice. Many young doctors are extremely frustrated because the hours are very long and it’s many years before they’re making decent money and have paid off their loans. It can be frustrating to not be able to afford to buy a new car until you’re in your 40’s while your classmates were living the good life beginning in their 20’s. In other words, a career choice isn’t just about what school subjects you’ve done well at. To consider the financial implications of your career choice, have a look at some lists of starting and average salaries for careers that would make use of your technical interests and skills such as this one:

Only time will tell. You know your interests, but are those also your aptitudes? Just from those interests I would look into biomedical engineering or chemical engineering. Can you tell I have a bias towards engineering? I admit I do. Try and find some people that are working in jobs you think might be a fit for you and see if anything comes to mind. Once you start school if you are quick to find the major you want you can change with minimal loss. The longer you go the more you might not get credit for, but you will still keep the knowledge. Best of luck, Jim
